questions.name: What is the keyword to define a variable in Python?
questions.about: Python uses dynamic typing for variables.

questions.name: How do you write a single-line comment in Python?
questions.about: Comments in Python are used for documentation.

questions.name: What is the output of print(type(42))?
questions.about: Python has built-in functions to check types.

questions.name: How do you create a list in Python?
questions.about: Lists are a fundamental data structure in Python.

questions.name: What is None in Python?
questions.about: None represents the absence of a value in Python.

questions.name: What keyword defines a function in Python?
questions.about: Functions in Python are defined using a specific keyword.

questions.name: What does *args mean in a function definition?
questions.about: *args allows a function to accept multiple arguments.

questions.name: What is the purpose of return in Python?
questions.about: return statements are used to exit a function and return a value.
questions.correctAnswer: To return a value from a function

questions.name: Can a Python function have default arguments?
questions.about: Default arguments provide fallback values for function parameters.

questions.name: What is a lambda function in Python?
questions.about: Lambda functions are anonymous functions in Python.

questions.name: What keyword defines a class in Python?
questions.about: Classes in Python are defined using a specific keyword.

questions.name: What is the purpose of __init__ in Python?
questions.about: __init__ is used to initialize class instances.

questions.name: What is self in Python?
questions.about: self refers to the instance of the class in Python.

questions.name: What is a class method in Python?
questions.about: Class methods are defined using a specific decorator.
questions.correctAnswer: A method bound to the class
incorrectAnswers: A method bound to an instance

questions.name: What is inheritance in Python?
questions.about: Inheritance allows one class to inherit from another.
questions.correctAnswer: A class inheriting from another class
incorrectAnswers: A function inheriting from another function

questions.name: How do you append an item to a list in Python?
questions.about: Lists in Python have methods to modify their contents.

questions.name: What does pop() do to a list in Python?
questions.about: pop() is a method to remove items from a list.
questions.correctAnswer: Removes and returns the last item

questions.name: How do you get the length of a list in Python?
questions.about: Python provides a built-in function to get the length of a list.

questions.name: What does list slicing do in Python?
questions.about: List slicing allows you to extract a portion of a list.
questions.correctAnswer: Extracts a portion of the list

questions.name: How do you reverse a list in Python?
questions.about: Lists in Python have a method to reverse their order.
